Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.view.gui

Class GUIView

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.view.gui.GUIView
public final class GUIView extends Object

Central class of the GUI view. Possesses high-level display and input methods.

Instantiates a Window and updates it to display the extension of JPanel corresponding to the current scene.

Also manipulates directly the current scene's main class, calling their lower-level display or input methods.

Receives and performs display requests from a DisplayMediator. Possesses one display method per situation when display on the GUI is required. Not concerned by some display requests.

Receives and performs input requests from the InputMediator with which it is associated. Possesses one input method per type of input request that can be performed by the Graphical Interface. The InputMediator keeps the GUI when it receives user input from this view or from other concurrent ones.

See Also:
  • DisplayMediator
  • ConcreteDisplayMediator
  • InputMediator
  • ConcreteInputMediator
  • Window
  • fr.sos.witchhunt.view.gui.scenes
  • is the central class of the Main Menu scene
  • is the central class of the game setup scene (players creation)
  • GamePanel is the central class of the ingame scene

    • inputMediator

      private InputMediator inputMediator
      The InputMediator gathering input from this Graphical User Interface.

      Sends input requests. Receives user-input and keeps all concurrent views synchronized in terms of input collection.

      See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GUIView

      public GUIView(InputMediator im)

      Creates a Graphical User Interface working for the given InputMediator.

      Instantiates a unique Window, which will be used as a frame for all Graphical User Interface displays.

      Parameters:
      im - Value for field inputMediator. The InputMediator keeping this view synchronized with others and sending its input requests.
      See Also:
      • InputMediator
      • inputMediator
      • Window

  • Method Details

    • gotoMainMenuPanel

      public void gotoMainMenuPanel()
      Switches to the Main Menu scene.

      No effect if this scene is already the current one.

      The currently active scene is destroyed.

      Resizing the Window is not allowed for this scene.

    • gotoMatchSetupPanel

      public void gotoMatchSetupPanel()
      Switches to the match setup scene.

      No effect if this scene is already the current one or if this class does not know the instance of Tabletop it represents.

      The currently active scene is destroyed.

      Resizing the Window is allowed for this scene.

      The window's title is modified when switching to this scene.

    • gotoGamePanel

      public void gotoGamePanel()
      Switches to the ingame scene and initializes it.

      No effect if this scene is already the current one or if this class does not know the instance of Tabletop it represents.

      The currently active scene is destroyed.

      Resizing the Window is allowed for this scene.

      The window's title is modified when switching to this scene.

    • wannaContinue

      public void wannaContinue()

      Calls the GamePanel::wannaContinue(InputMediator) method, which freezes the game and asks for user input to unpause it.

      Used when the master InputMediator sends a "wanna continue ?" input request.

      See Also:
      • InputMediator::wannaContinue()
      • ConcreteInputMediator::wannaContinue()
      • GamePanel::wannaContinue(InputMediator)

    • makeChoice

      public void makeChoice()

      Calls the ChoicesPanel::makeChoice(InputMediator) method for the current scene's ChoicesPanel, if it has one, activating its controller to collect user input. Not in charge of the display of the menu, see displayMenu(Menu).

      Used when the master InputMediator asks the users to choose between plural possibilities to let the user make its choice using this Graphical Interface.

      ChoicesPanel is a class dedicated to representing a Menu on the Graphical Interface. It is used by a scene.

      See Also:
      • InputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • ConcreteInputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • GamePanel::makeChoice()
      • MainMenuPanel::makeChoice()
      • ChoicesPanel
      • ChoicesPanel::makeChoice(InputMediator)
      • Menu

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu(Menu m)

      Calls the ChoicesPanel::displayMenu(Menu) method for the current scene's ChoicesPanel, displaying the entitled and options of the given Menu. Not in charge of collecting the user's choice, see makeChoice().

      Used when the master DisplayMediator orders to display a Menu on all concurrent views.

      ChoicesPanel is a class dedicated to representing a Menu on the Graphical Interface. It is used by a scene.

      See Also:
      • DisplayMediator::displayMenu(Menu)
      • ConcreteDisplayMediator::displayMenu(Menu)
      • GamePanel::displayMenu(Menu)
      • MainMenuPanel::displayMenu(Menu)
      • ChoicesPanel
      • ChoicesPanel::displayMenu(Menu)
      • Menu

    • choiceHasBeenMade

      public void choiceHasBeenMade(Object o)

      Called by the master InputMediator when it has asked the users to choose between plural possibilities and received their answer to update the active scene, telling it "okay, we got an answer, you can stop harassing our users".

      If the current scene is the ingame scene, calls its choiceHasBeenMade(Object) method.

      Otherwise, if it is the the main menu scene, calls its resetChoicesPanel method.

      Parameters:
      o - The chosen Menu entry.
      See Also:
      • InputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • ConcreteInputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • GamePanel::choiceHasBeenMade(Object)
      • MainMenuPanel::resetChoicesPanel()
      • Menu::getOptions()

    • displayCardsChoiceMenu

      private void displayCardsChoiceMenu(Menu m, boolean forceReveal)
      Displays a Menu containing only Rumour cards as entries on the ingame scene, if it is active.
      Parameters:
      m - A menu containing entries of type RumourCard.
      forceReveal - If this boolean is true, even unrevealed Rumour cards' information will be visible.
      See Also:
      • GamePanel::displayCards(Menu, boolean)
      • RumourCard

    • stringifyRumourCard

      private String stringifyRumourCard(RumourCard rc, boolean forceReveal, Supplier<String>... effectGetters)

      Transforms a Rumour card into a String (GUI version).

      Used for displaying cards-related messages (played a Witch? effect, discarded a card ...) in the ingame scene.

      The /+/ "catch up indentation" special sequence is replaced with spaces in order to make a paragraph out of the card's description.

      Parameters:
      rc - A Rumour card to stringify
      forceReveal - The unrevealed cards' name and properties will be hidden unless this boolean is set to true.
      effectGetters - An array of String getters giving the wanted parts of the cards' description. See for example : RumourCard::getWitchEffectDescription()
      Returns:
      A String describing the given card's, which can be used for display on the GUI view.
      See Also:
      • RumourCard
      • RumourCard::getAdditionalEffectDescription()
      • RumourCard::getAdditionalEffectDescription()
      • RumourCard::getHuntEffectDescription()
      • displayPlayerPlaysWitchEffectScreen(Player, RumourCard)
      • displayChooseHuntCardScreen(Player, RumourCardsPile)
      • displayPlayerHasDiscardedCardScreen(Player, RumourCard)
      • displayPlayerHasChosenCardScreen(Player, RumourCard, RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • displayStealCardScreen(Player, Player)
      • displayPlayerHasResetCardScreen(Player, RumourCard)
      • a Supplier<T> is a method taking no entry parameter and returning an object of type T.

    • playerChoosesOwnCard

      private boolean playerChoosesOwnCard(Player p, RumourCardsPile from)

      Asserts whether the given deck belongs to the given player or not.

      Used to know whether the ingame scene has to show the given deck's view or not.

      Parameters:
      p - Is this one player the owner of the following deck ?
      from - Does this pile of cards belong to the given Player ?
      Returns:
      true if the deck belongs to the given player, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • RumourCardsPile
      • Player Player
      • displayChooseAnyCardScreen(Player, RumourCardsPile)
      • displayChooseUnrevealedCardScreen(Player, RumourCardsPile)
      • displayChooseRevealedCardScreen(Player, RumourCardsPile)
      • displayChooseCardToDiscardScreen(Player)
